text:
I install apach2.2.3 as usual with apt-get. But this time, when I started
apache2 after initial configuration, I encountered this error:

 sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart
 * Forcing reload of web server (apache2)...                                   
Syntax error on line 20 of /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/000-default:
Invalid command 'ScriptAlias', perhaps misspelled or defined by a module not
included in the server configuration
                                                                         [fail]

at the last try I do, I leave the default configuration about apache2.conf,
000-default and other files, but I have again the same error.

I look around internet and bug's report, and the official documentation, but I
don't find anything can help me. All the material I find, are 'bout the behavoir
of apache2 after start.

Thanks in advance
creator: stefano@mmail.it
tony@pc-tony.com
text:
Stefano,

This is not the correct arena to obtain support. This is a place to record bugs
in the Apache products.

From the sounds of things though, you have an issue with your installation on
Debian/Ubuntu, you should either read the documentation that comes with these
packages or seek help in the one of the Apache support forums:

http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/faq/

The mailing list, and the IRC channels being the two most common methods.

Cheers,
Tony
